action.action-desc: Mr. McClintock introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To repeal the Jones Act restrictions on coastwise trade, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Open America's Waters Act.

section.header: Repeal of certain limitations on coastwise trade

subsection.text: Section 12112(a) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
A coastwise endorsement may be issued for a vessel that qualifies under the laws of the United States to engage in the coastwise trade.

Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commandant of the United States Coast Guard shall issue regulations to implement the amendment made by subsection (a) that require all vessels permitted to engage in the coastwise trade to meet all appropriate safety and security requirements.
